intro: Zauschneria viscosa, commonly known as the sticky zauschneria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its sticky, glandular leaves and bright orange to red flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
